jobs.title: Associate Software Engineer

researchProjects.title: LLM-based C/C++ Vulnerability Detection Benchmark
researchProjects.introduction: In this project, I constructed a benchmark dataset of C/C++ vulnerabilities called SecVulEval. It solves the lack of statement-level granularity and contextual information in previous datasets.
descriptions: Curated 25,440 functions, including vulnerable statements and contextual information, related to the vulnerabilities.
Designed and implemented an agentic vulnerability detection framework to evaluate various LLMs on C/C++ vulnerability detection.
Made the dataset publicly available at HuggingFace - SecVulEval for community use.
Published the details of the work in the paper SecVulEval: Benchmarking LLMs for Real-World C/C++ Vulnerability Detection.

researchProjects.title: Bug Detection Framework for Java Static Analysis Tools with LLMs
researchProjects.introduction: Static analysis tools are widely adopted in the industry to detect bugs in software systems. However, it is important that the tools themselves are reliable, i.e., do not miss bugs or produce false positives. In this project, I created an LLM-based metamorphic testing framework to detect inconsistencies in Java static analysis tools.
descriptions: Analyzed 3 popular Java static analysis tools: SpotBugs, ErrorProne, and PMD.
Designed and implemented an LLM-based metamorphic testing framework to uncover faulty rule implementations in Java static analysis tools.
Evaluated 5 widely used coding LLMs—GPT-4o, CodeLlama-34B, Codestral-22B, DeepSeek-Coder-33B, and Qwen2.5-Coder-32B.—on their ability to uncover bugs in the static analysis tools.
Uncovered total 42 faulty rule implementations in all 3 tools. All the bugs have been reported to the respective developers.
